sections.general: adventure run coordinator career focus i am a fitness enthusiast and enjoy living a healthy and active lifestyle. â i currently oversee and coordinate many aspects of events in the running community which has made me efficient, a quick problem solver and very attentive to a customers needs or concerns. â core qualifications time efficient self-motivated encouragingâ energetic organized hard worker activeâ goal oriented education and training bachelor of arts : psychology sociology , may 2013 arizona state university ï¼​ city , state , united states gpa: gpa: 2.3 gpa: 3.0 2.3 gpa: 3.0 minor-sociologyâ
sections.interests: being active in the community. â setting fitness and running oriented goals and achieving them. â i signed up for a full 140.6 ironman in arizona in 2014 and successfully completed it in november 2015. â i enjoy running long distances, cycling, hiking, swimming and anything outdoors or that involves being active. â i also enjoy helping others through charity projects, events and fundraising.â
sections.skills: have experience working on multiple different pos systems, microsoft, excel and other organization sites used for scheduling. â also, very experienced with g-drive and all its applications. â i am a quick and efficient problem solver when hit with an issue whether it being working under a short time frame or scheduling and unexpected issues that arise. â managing and communicating with others, not only staff members with information but also leading a team on a regular basis. â high and motivating energy when working with others but able to adjust is to an appropriate level. accomplishments finishing ironman arizona (140.6 miles)- not work related but trained roughly 20 hours a week while upholding great performance at work. it required excellent time management skills, relentless drive and motivation from within. adventure run coordinator-hosted free community monthly runs ranging from 250 to 550 (two different locations), motivated them and marketed the event to increase by 12% over two years with 30% of the participants being brand new. also, managed and communicated with staff and volunteers details and tasks throughout event. girls on the run coach fall/spring of 2013- leading and teaching young girls life skills through running (30 girls at age of 9-11) team in training captain spring 2012- motivating other runners and walkers on the team as they trained and reached their goal of running a marathon, via in person, email and while out running. (12 participants)
